Caption: Figure 10. Result of frame rate recovery using the motion field prior. By transferring the motion field from the prior video, intermediate frames (within dashed boxes) that appear seamless can be synthesized. Note that here we are doubling the frame rate.

Fig. 10 shows the result of frame rate recovery. The
prior video is captured at 30 frames per second (fps), and
the frame rate of the input video is 15 fps. Although the
color distributions in two videos are different, our method
was able to seamlessly generate intermediate frames using
motion field transfer. In this example, we only show the
video chat scenario; however, the same technique can be
used in other scenarios where the types of possible motion
are predictable.
